relation: I feel very secure on campus.
If you area Florida resident the value is better than average.
There is plenty to do for fun. The beach is close. There is a local aquarium, Mote Marine, parks, museums, theaters, and shopping. Within a couple of hours to numerous theme parks.
The cafeteria is okay. There are numerous dining alternatives closed by.
The classes are challenging, but not extremely hard.
Be proactive. Communicate with your teachers if you have a problem. Do not procrastinate.
SCF has a wide range of classes to get you started with your college education. The facilities are nice and with several locations in the area. SCF offers day and evening classes as well as online.
pageTitle: State College of Florida-Manatee-Sarasota Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {167405=SCF professors do not overwhelm their students with busy work! Every essay, project, and presentation has a meaning and a goal as listed in the teacher's syllabus. The syllabus tells a student what to expect from the class and what is expected of the student! The rigor of the class matches up with the level of the class. A 3000 or 4000 level class will be more challenging than a 1000 or 2000 level., 290493=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Great for these types of students ~Undecided majors. ~Nursing Students ~Those with lots of talent. Tips for prospective students Don't feel too bad if MCC wasn't your top choice. There's always the chance you can transfer... and think of it this way, you can keep a job without having to worry about whether or not you'll have it after the summer, and you can live without paying for your own room and board if you're living with your parents. Login to rate or flag the reviews emily from North Port, FL 01/12/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 2 out of 2 people found this review useful. 3 of 79 Categories Comments Great for these types of students If you want to talk about your grades to your professors SCF is perfect. The classes are not crowded and teachers have time for you. Tips for prospective students Become best friends with your guidance counselor! Though the website has all the information you can
